title.narrative: Resilience and Recovery through Cash for Assets in Damasak

description.narrative: Assessments show that Damasak was a socio-economic hub for agriculture, fishing and animal raising prior to the conflict. The project will sustain the interventions of those preceding and utilize community mobilization to engage communities and livelihood groups in identifying community assets and related livelihoods for recovery. This will be done through a participatory approach, joint mapping and prioritization. A cash for assets modality will follow, where communities, groups or households are provided cash in exchange for work in recovering these assets or livelihoods, which complements the interventions of other key players in the area that target direct distribution of cash, in kind food, seeds and agricultural implements and shelter kit. Action Against Hunger designed the intervention to find a niche where recipient of inputs from other humanitarian stakeholders are able to maximize their use. Finally, livelihoods or livelihood groups will be linked to larger systems of support. The flexibility of Cash for Assets modality allows a humanitarian approach, and Early Recovery and Resilience can bridge the two phases.

The project will build on the gains that initial distributions have made in arresting a potentially catastrophic humanitarian situation and drive this towards early recovery and resilience building of the affected population.
